input_text:
Job Title: SRO Tech II - 2nd Shift

Location: Largo, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Purpose

The Service Technician evaluates, troubleshoots to component level, completes, and documents repairs of analog and digital camera controllers, camera heads, light sources, optical couplers, and other products as directed. Completes required repairs by aligning or upgrading software, burning-in, and testing (Final Check Out) of Returned Goods. Repairs and documentation must be in compliance with regulatory requirements. Primary objective is to complete repairs in a timely manner to reduce turnaround time and improve customer satisfaction.

Duties And Responsibilities

 Analyze Returned Good customer feedback/complaint and compare symptom to alleged product failure Perform troubleshooting to component level as necessary to determine failure Provide failure analysis information to Engineering to support root cause investigation as necessary Provide estimates of repair cost for customer quote as necessary Route repairs to Production as appropriate Complete repair/upgrade as necessary/appropriate Complete burn-in, Final Checkout, and safety testing as required Update repair/complaint and device history records as required Maintain product change history file for reference of applicable engineering changes effecting repaired products. Perform Oracle Transactions (Verify Service Request, Comment on Serviceable items, review quoted cost to determine if higher authorization is needed and if work can be performed within the quoted cost.

Required Qualifications

 Two years’ experience in electronic/mechanical assembly and soldering experience within the past 12 months. Must be able to perform work at a workbench height of 37.5”-42”, sit and stand as necessary, move about, bend, stoop, use hands and lift up to 40 lbs periodically as needed.

Preferred Qualifications

 Electronic Technician or Repair Technician experience preferred. AA/AS Degree in Electronic Technology or equivalent experience preferred.

Benefits

CONMED offers a wide array of benefits to fit your unique needs. Visit our Benefits Page for more information.

Competitive compensationExcellent healthcare including medical, dental, vision and prescription coverageShort & long term disability plus life insurance -- cost paid fully by CONMEDRetirement Savings Plan (401K) -- CONMED matches your contributions dollar for dollar, with the potential for up to 7% per pay periodEmployee Stock Purchase Plan -- allows stock purchases at discounted priceTuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate level courses

Know someone at CONMED? 

Have them submit you as a referral before applying for this position to be eligible for our Employee Referral Program incentives!

CONMED is an Equal Opportunity Employer & an Affirmative Action Employer. CONMED is a strong advocate of workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, citizenship status, or veteran status.

If you feel you need a reasonable accommodation pursuant to the ADA, you are encouraged to contact us at 800-325-5900 option #3.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
